result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:19 AM Defendant Timothy D McKay in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Timothy D McKay.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed. 
Court informs attorney Wang if they wish to obtain a sooner date, to reach out to the Clerk's office to see if there are any sooner dates that can be given.
Hearing scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives, including crossbows.

1:49 PM Defendant Timothy D McKay in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Timothy D McKay. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is currently on a probation and parole hold. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.
